HOMESCHOOLING TOGETHER

Recommended Resources

Some of the local and not-so-local public resources that have been recommended in our newsletter over the past few years.  For ongoing ideas and referrals, subscribe to the Homeschooling Together newsletter.

I much appreciate your help in keeping these links up-to-date.  Please let me know if you come across a broken one.  You can also contact me if you are a local homeschooler with a listing to add, but I will NOT be adding advertisers, so don't bother writing if you're trying to sell something.

Please forgive the somewhat arbitrary categorizing that follows.  I felt that I needed to break up the list somehow.

  • ARTS & CRAFTS
  • BOOKS, MAGAZINES & OTHER SUPPLIES
  • CAMPS & OUTDOORS
  • COMMUNITY & OTHER COLLEGES, CLASSES
  • DRAMA
  • FIELD TRIP IDEAS
  • FOREIGN LANGUAGE
  • GAMES & SPORTS
  • LITERATURE, WRITING
  • MATH & SCIENCE
  • MUSIC & DANCE
  • SOCIAL STUDIES
  • STUFF WE DO TOGETHER
    •

    ARTS & CRAFTS

    Arlington Center for the Arts, designer programs as well as programs already in place
    Art and Soul
    ArtBeat, Mass Ave., Arlington
    Awakening Arts
    Barn Studio, High St., West Medford (pottery)
    Bead Affaire, Watertown
    DeCordova Museum, 51 Sandy Pond Road, Lincoln
    Fine Art Instruction, Susan Axe-Bronk, AXEBRONK@aol.com
    Harrisville Designs, Inc., Center Village, PO Box 806, Harrisville, NH 03450 (weaving supplies)
    Leventhal-Sidman Jewish Community Center (aka Newton JCC)
    Mudflat Studios, 149 Broadway, Somerville
    Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
    The New Art Center, Newton
    Observational drawing classes - Erica Beade, 617-924-1941, e.beade@verizon.net
    Silk painting instruction, Elena Neva, lenasu@msn.com
    Worcester Art Museum
